intro: Hieracium macrotrichum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow flowers surrounded by pale green ray florets, and its leaves are typically hairy, giving it its common name. It thrives in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, often forming dense colonies. Hieracium macrotrichum is an herbaceous perennial that can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
